metadata.title: CVE-2018-8106 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - negligible
metadata.description:
The JPXStream::readTilePartData function in JPXStream.cc in xpdf 4.00allows attackers to launch denial of service (heap-based buffer over-readand application crash) via a specific pdf file, as demonstrated bypdftohtml.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8106` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
libpoppler111 - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
poppler-utils - 0.62.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xpdf package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
poppler package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.62.0-1ubuntu1').
ipe package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
